sourceMeaningMnemonic:
Balance a <radical>spoon</radical> on your pointed <radical>fingers</radical> and it will always point <kanji>north</kanji>. The spoon is like a compass needle and your fingers guide the knowledge your body already has and uses it to point north. That's science, friends!

Notice how the fingers radical is a little different here? That's because you're pointing them really hard.
meaningInfo: Imagine taking a spoon and balancing it on your fingers. Now watch the spoon spin spin spin until it stops and ultimately points north.
readingMnemonic: You realize that this ability to find <kanji>north</kanji> is probably really valuable, so you go to the nearest pawn shop and <reading>hock</reading> (<ja>ほく</ja>) it. Even your fingers.
readingInfo: Imagine walking out of a pawn shop after hocking your fingers and spoon and realizing that you don't know where you are. Oh, if only you could tell where north was...
